entry.question: What is Stealth?
entry.answer: Stealth is a new keyword ability that lets some characters strike from the shadows without fear of reprisal. When choosing which enemy to attack, you must attack a character without stealth if able.

entry.question: If my opponent has one tapped character with stealth, and the rest of their creatures are untapped, which character can I attack?
entry.answer: Stealth doesn’t override the rules for attacking tapped/untapped characters. Since the tapped character is the only one that can be attacked, that’s where your attack is headed.

entry.question: What happens if a character has brave and stealth?
entry.answer: Brave and stealth essentially cancel each other out. You must attack that character if able, and you must attack other characters if able. This basically means you must attack a character you can attack, the same as if those abilities weren’t there.

entry.question: Razorclaw’s robot mode ability says that when he flips to that mode he can attack untapped characters that turn as though they were tapped. If a character has Stealth when untapped, does Razorclaw treat them as tapped or untapped for the purpose of their Stealth?
entry.answer: The character will still have Stealth. Razorclaw’s ability changes the way that Razorclaw can attack but doesn’t actually change the Tapped/Untapped state of other cards.

entry.question: If you have a Stealthiness attached to Headstrong in his Alternate Mode, what happens? Does Brave trump the Stealth or vice versa?
entry.answer: The opponent can choose to attack any available target; they essentially cancel each other out.
